titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Alain Arias-Misson Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 03:07
profiledesc.descrules: translation missing: en.enumerations.resource_finding_aid_description_rules.Describing Archives: A Content Standard

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection documents the literary work and career of Alain Arias-Misson and consists of correspondence; writings and works by Arias-Misson including poetry, visual poetry, notes, and other writings; writings and visual poetry by others; printed material including cards, pamphlets, ephemera, exhibition catalogs, serials, and books; and born-digital audiovisual materials. Correspondence includes letters to and from both general and literary correspondents. Works of others include work by Jean-François Bory and Ugo Carrega.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: The collection documents the literary work and career of Alain Arias-Misson and consists of correspondence; writings and works by Arias-Misson including poetry, visual poetry, notes, and other writings; writings and visual poetry by others; printed material including cards, pamphlets, ephemera, exhibition catalogs, serials, and books; and born-digital audiovisual materials. Correspondence includes letters to and from both general and literary correspondents. Works of others include work by Jean-François Bory and Ugo Carrega.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Alain Arias-Misson and Librairie Patrick Fréchet on the Edwin J. Beinecke Book Fund, 2018.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Alain Arias-Misson Papers. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into eight series: I. Correspondence, 1960-2014. II. Poems, notes, and writings, 1959-2017. III. Works by others, 1956-1993. IV. Visual poetry and related materials, 1958-2017. V. Cards, pamphlets, and other ephemera, 1959-2004. VI. Plexiglas and other projects, 1960-2017. VII. Printed materials, 1962-2017. VIII. Electronic media, 2009.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This material is open for research.
Box 41 (DVD): Restricted fragile material. Access copies of digital files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

bioghist.head: Alain Arias-Misson
bioghist.p: Alain Arias-Misson (born 1936) is a Belgian artist and poet.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Alain Arias-Misson Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections as they are acquired, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.
This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and minimal organization.

Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Correspondence is organized into two groupings: general correspondence and literary correspondence. This organization preserves the arrangement as received from Alain Arias-Misson.

scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of both personal and business correspondence related to literary works.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The arrangement is roughly chronological, preserving the order as received from Alain Arias-Misson.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of manuscript, typescript, and carbon works of visual poetry and artwork by friends of Alain Arias-Misson.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by artist or poet.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of examples of visual poetry by Alain Arias-Misson and other artists and related materials documenting their work.
